website_summaries.verdict: The best budget headphone audio jack adapter meant to connect small devices to larger audio systems.
pros: The 6.35 mm male side is compatible with most advanced and professional audio systems
Can connect audio devices, microphones, and some other musical instruments
cons: Audio quality can distort at medium to high volume levels depending on the input

customer_reviews.title: One worked, two didn't. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three adapters were completely unusable because of being terribly loose or apart in multiple pieces.The ONE that works works well and I foresee no problems with it as I will not be removing it from my amp at all. Every time I see products like this where there are a few really bad reviews and a lot of good ones I get worried about me being among those unfortunate souls that get the short end of the stick. It happened this time. Your mileage may very, purchase at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Duggan

customer_reviews.title: guitar amps use mono plugs
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the proper adaptors. There are stereo 1/4 plugs and there are mono plugs. If you have a guitar amp, you need a mono 1/4 inch to stereo headphone plug not this one. If you have a behringer stereo amp and or midi keyboard then buy this. I've seen all kinds of reviews about plugging adaptors in 90% to get them to work in both channels, right doesnt work, or you get unreliable signal or whatever, but they are probably mixing mono equipment and stereo plugs. I've done it too. Look carefully, and troubleshoot before calling them defective pos. These work perfectly with my stereo stuff.
customer_reviews.author: v 303

customer_reviews.title: The 3.5 port is too small
customer_reviews.text: The 3.5 port is so small I could get in the 3.5mm plug 1/4 of the way no matter what brand I used. Tried Sony, Beats, Apple, Phillips, and others. I major defect. It is not worth even one star. How is it Amazon's Choice???
customer_reviews.author: KSV

customer_reviews.title: Don't last long.
customer_reviews.text: So I happened to only need one. I probably used it a dozen times and it had fallen apart totally. No problem, I have two more. Well, they don't last long and the internal connections were poor causing static or dual positive to L/R with no ground. And it was the same story with all phones and patches. A little over a year later all three have fallen apart. I have even put them back together and they fall back apart. I plugged/unplugged infrequently and never jerked or bumped on them. They have good reviews overall so maybe I got a bad batch. I will be searching for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: fruitwerks

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: They all broke after a week. Maybe if I didn't unplug them they'd be fine, but alas, they pulled apart. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: FafnirSpiral

customer_reviews.title: Low profile and work great
customer_reviews.text: This is the smallest adapter I have and it works almost flawlessly. I have a few others but they're rather bulky. This one almost makes it seem like you're not even using an adapter. My only complaint is for one of my earphones, if I push the connector in all the way, it seems to mess with the signal because the sound gets muffled. I have to pull out the earphone connector a tad before everything clears up. But that was with only one pair and I didn't have any others to test with. Might have been just that pair. Either way, they are small, look great, and work!
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: These adapters seem to work well. The input side is nice and flat which provides and unobstructed connection for whatever type of headphone jack you're plugging it into. Right angle, straight, big fat connectors, small earbud connectors or whatever. They have a nice positive connection which is both tactile and visible that seats well and securely. The only thing I wish it had was some texture on the barrel. It's hard to get a grip on it when pulling out of 1/4 jack, especially if it's in a tight spot like a mixer where there are tons of other cable close by. Other than that, looks great, works great, great price, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Received 5, ony 4 worked - 1 was defective.
customer_reviews.text: These connectors are not exactly rocket science. They either work or they don't. No one out there is actually measuring the electrical properties of these connectors at the entire operating spectrum to quantitatively define which is the best and which is the worst. I ordered 5, 1 was bad (meaning that it only worked in mono, not stereo). Fortunately, I only really NEEDED 4 to work, so huzzah. However, if 20% of what I ordered is not functional then you lose two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.J

customer_reviews.title: Not durable breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Looked cool and worked at first but have been falling apart. I bought 30 of these for use with headphones with kids and at least 10 have failed within one month. Little gold ring falls off then the whole piece comes apart. Junky Maybe I got a bad batch Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Neil Burton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy headphone adapters
customer_reviews.text: These 6.35mm Male to 3.5mm Female Stereo Adapters are well made for listening. They are sturdy and seem well made. It's a bit hard to get the plug into them because the contacts are tight, but that's a good thing. The only problem I have is with some headphone plugs the two channels are mixed, shorted between left and right so no stereo. I think it's related to slight differences in the tip and ring position on the plug. It's mostly noticeable on a headphone with a mic so there is an extra ring on the plug. I have used many of these that fall apart or have loose connections and these are much better!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Laurel

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING IS MADE LIKE IT USED TO BE ... IT'S ALL CRAP!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 3 pack lol, 1 didn't work straight out of the package, 1 was hit n miss, depending on how much i toggled the Headphone jack in and out, I might get clear sound, and the last one did work decently ... for about a month, til the little washer on the end fell OUT. then upon putting it back together ... muddled sound!!! WHY ARE MANUFACTURERS ALLOWED TO CONTINUE TO WASTE PRECIOUS RESOURCES WITH THIS CRAP!! THEY KNOW ITS CRAP BECAUSE THEY ARE THE ONES WHO MAKE THESE CRAPPY ITEMS!! SICK AND TIRED OF CRAP!!
customer_reviews.author: AL1976

customer_reviews.title: Two of Three Adaptors Do Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Update (7/21/2017): Received three more. None worked. The problem: When headphones are plugged in all the way, the sound is faint and tinny. Only when headphones are slightly unplugged is the sound better. Why is this the case? I have no idea. It could be some kind of short in the adaptor or a manufacturing defect that puts the conductors slightly too shallow or too deep. I am returning these adaptors. Update (7/18/2017): The seller has shipped me a new pack of three for free. I will try them to see if more work. Two of the three adaptors do not work. I have contacted the seller. I will update this review with their response.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Braun

customer_reviews.title: Compared to my one generic & Grado adapter these are sub-par.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of suspicious of the overwhelming positives here. I received a 3 pack of these Aurum adapters. I immediately began to notice a loss of signal/sound/whatever on hooking it up to my Schiit Heresy. With some jiggling it was improved but that's not how I want to use a headphone adapter. It wasn't the amp nor the headphones--I checked against the other adapters I have and it was definitely the Aurum adapters. Each one. Cheaply made? Not sure, but definitely poorly made. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: Good adapter, good price
customer_reviews.text: These 6.5mm (1/4") male to 3.5 mm female adapters are a solid fit on both ends and pass audio reliably with no static and no dropouts. I'm using the adapters in a home studio environment. My mixing boards have 1/4" headphone jacks as does my headphone distribution amplifier. Most new headphones and earbuds have 3.5mm connections, so, having these adapters is necessity. I have had some serious issues with cheap,unreliable 1/4" stereo female to female adapters from other companies. That said, these Aurum adapters worked like a champ and I'm using them for all my 1/4" to 3.5mm adapter connections.
customer_reviews.author: 14liberty.

customer_reviews.title: Okay in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: These adapters do not hold up very well. I used them largely for connecting sound cable to amps for corporate events. The first one I had decided it had a hard life, right out of the package, and fell apart almost immediately. The other two have held together better but I find that I regularly have to tighten them so they don't fall apart. When these adapters work, they work well. When they're loose, sound only part way comes through and they have some issues. They're good in a pinch or, for events where you know you might lose some equipment and are okay with it. I would not recommend if you're looking for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron W.

customer_reviews.title: Shoot - These things work Great
customer_reviews.text: That's right - You can't go wrong with these things. Shoot - Get the pick-up truck - these things work great. You take it out of the package and put it in the 1/4" hole and bam you have 1/8" adapter for your headphones. It's like a modern-day miracle. Who knew you could go use an adapter and it works so well. I know we have engineered many things in life. But an adapter so you don't have to purchase new headphones. That is amazing. Don't hesitate to get these - they are simply the best thing since sliced bread.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Look great but looks can be deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: It is always hard to assume the quality when buying something like this. These look and feel great but they don't work good. I use these adapters for our in ear monitoring system at church and any time the cable moves in that adapter I get bad noises. They were so bad I had to stop using them. Spend your money on another adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Colt and Missy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I didn’t want to bother my roommates/neighbors with my digital piano, so I got this pack to plug in headphones. Now I can play at all odd hours of the night in blissful peace. The adapters are great quality and come in a pack of 3. I haven’t had it long, but the quality is crystal clear with no distortion to my headphones. It’s an excellent value too - if you go to a local store, this price (I paid $7) would get you a 1 pack. Nothing else to say, really. I’ve used it every day since I got it a little less than two weeks ago and it’s worked wonderfully. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hamish

customer_reviews.title: Broke apart
customer_reviews.text: I thought that these were great when I first received them. They were secure, sounded great and overall looked like a solid product. after using one it broke apart after the second use. I thought that it was just a defective one so i grabbed another. I purchased these in January. It is March and I am down to one. They have all broke apart with light use.
customer_reviews.author: Darius20737

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, great value.
customer_reviews.text: I found the Aurum 3.5mm to 1/4" adapters to be excellent as the adapters I was using before were mono, which made monitoring challenging because sound only came through the left channel. The Aurum adapters are stereo adapters. I also appreciated the fact that they came in a 3-pack. Adapters like this are increasingly difficult to find, so being able to get them from this vendor via Amazon was great. They also arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: K. BRUTON

customer_reviews.title: All 3 adapters have fallen apart over time with very light use
customer_reviews.text: The adapters themselves are usually left plugged in and I occasionally plug a different 3.5mm device in. With mild movement of the 3.5mm jack the internals of the adapter have come loose and eventually the sound quality drops or sound drops out entirely if the jack isn't in just the right position. Spend a little extra and get some better quality adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Randizzle9000

customer_reviews.title: Nice 1/4" to 1/8" Adapters
customer_reviews.text: The price was great, the 3 pack is the way to go so you can have a spare or two. I really like the size, these are a little shorter in overall length than most & that is a good thing. I am using one on my Ham Radio transceiver for my Morse Code key and it is perfect. Also my daughter is using one for her audio mixer headphone jack & it also works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Evans

customer_reviews.title: was glad to find these and feel like i made the right choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could run my amazon kindle into my guitar amps, so I could run background music into the amp and play along with it. Also to plug my ear buds into my 80's rack stereo. They work great for both purposes. The fit on both ends is nice and they seem to be constructed with quality materials and craftsmanship. Am hoping they will last a long time. Great price and quality!!
customer_reviews.author: kellchris2k

customer_reviews.title: Can't have enough of these
customer_reviews.text: I work in field production for television. Audio adapters of all sorts are needed on a daily basis, and often I need to share with crew. A set of three of these gives me one or two for my gear, and one to share. I'll be ordering these at least a couple more times to keep up with the demands of the job and how things like these often walk away. They're solid, make good contact, and carry audio without fail.
customer_reviews.author: Michelangelo Flores

customer_reviews.title: Faulty jacks... lots of messing around to get them to work
customer_reviews.text: I read a review on these (through the many positives) that was negative in the sense of “only 1 out of the 3 worked”. I basically have the same problem. I figured that these should get plugged in all the way into my audio interface and then my headphone jack goes all the way in too... yet when i plug them both all the way in, no sound comes out. I have to mess with the plugs in order to hear any sound out of it. Once i get it into the proper orientation, it works great, but if i bump the plugs, the same thing happens again. I think i got faulty jacks!!! Pretty upset about that!
customer_reviews.author: Noah Wich

customer_reviews.title: Meh it works
customer_reviews.text: The quality is fair to middlin' and the sound is ok for normal household everyday use unless your OCD about your sound quality. That said I tried these out in my studio so that I could use my headphones that have an 1/8in jack and meh. Works ok so far but I wouldn't use this adapter for anything more than amateur recordings or household use. Other than that they do exactly as expected... they function. They havent fallen apart on me yet. If that happens Ill be writing another review
customer_reviews.author: trdrvr2

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart / broken after very little use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a few mos ago, pack of 3 and all three now have failed. The issue is the female socket on the 3.5mm end comes out after just a few insertion / removals. This happened also a year ago, same product, one the only one I had at the time. But it older so I thought was isolated and just worn out. Evidently not, I'd say poor design at a minimum. Buy something else, i.e. HOSA which are moulded.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Working Fine So Far
customer_reviews.text: These adapters were delivered good and on time. Appear to be well built and plated. Plugs fit snugly. Sound quality is fine (i.e., no apparent degradation due to the adapter -- they work as expected). I tried each one with my headphones plugged into my Casio WK-7600 keyboard and they all worked ok. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. I'm using them to convert between an 1/4" guitar amplifier jack and standard 3.5mm headphones jack. The adapters look and work great! They look and feel heavy duty so I expect them to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: So there's a lot of cheap garbage out there, but these are solid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought quite a few different ones since I was desperate for one to work with my Focusrite Scarlett and my Digital Piano. Of all the ones I bought, these are the best. The others will have faulty contact and connection causing major distortion in the audio. These fit snugly and have 0 issues. And you get 3, in case you lose them.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Jao

customer_reviews.title: Good price for great quality
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my new Focusrite, and they worked phenomenally. I would definitely recommend these to anyone who needs such an adapter. They click pretty nicely to the 3.5mm connector, and it does not come off easily like some other products. Fairly sturdy build too. The fact that it comes with 3 is pretty solid too. Will be ordering more in the near future :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: These lasted for a few concerts before coming to bits
customer_reviews.text: I used a two of these in concerts - and my choral group has concerts about once a month. By the end of the second concert, after being plugged in and out five or six times, one of these just fell apart. The pieces look good enough - brass and steel and plastic, but they really needed to use some non-conductive adhesive. I've tried another of these, and they just fall to bits under a little pressure or usage.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS TYPE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS TYPE, unlike other adaptors​ this casement does not have the protruding plastic housing that typically plays a role in its life expectancy. i.e when or fic the cabling is tripped over and yanked there's not a plastic housing to split apart. This entire housing is solid steel AND has a very low visible profile reducing any physical interference sticking out of the equipment being used
customer_reviews.author: Kevn Covington - Branson MO

customer_reviews.title: Heavily made with a nice tactile feel
customer_reviews.text: I liked the feel and heavy feel of the adaptors. Obviously designed with material quality in mind. Just the thing for plugging those little 1/8th adaptors into a mixer with no loss in sound quality. I have tried to use them for gaming, but I am sure these adapters would work well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: These are Fantastic For replicating music. Wonderful sound and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I bought the looks, they're actually very attractive in person. However they perform better than they look. They reproduce sound very accurate. I am an audiophile that enjoys music that is replicated soundly. You can feel confident these are worthy of your money. Also your time and a wonderful way to listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: phillip smith

customer_reviews.title: Does what you want, feels like nice quality
customer_reviews.text: These adapters are working fine for me, feels like good quality metal construction. I plugged all three into a 4-input headphone amplifier so I can have various headphones plugged in at the same time. The flat female end is nice, any 3.5mm jack should fit without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Family

customer_reviews.title: This adapters are great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these adapters to use with my headphones and a mixer board for recording/music. My old adapter was not connecting well and kept going in and out. These adapters immediately fixed that problem. They are really well made and feel unbreakable! They also had a nice tight connection so there were no issues with the headphone jack moving. Sound was great and price also was great for 3 of them.
customer_reviews.author: xswimguy

customer_reviews.title: Using on Behringer P16M
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Now, tbh, i've only had them a week, so durability rating may not be accurate. However, right out of the bag, these adapters were noticeably better than what we've been using. From the first audible click with real tension to snap in the 3mm headphone plug, I knew these were going to solve my "loose connector" problems. I have 7 artists onstage with in-ear-monitors. No floor wedges. The in-ear has to work. Every time. These appear to be the solution.
customer_reviews.author: CastleRanch

customer_reviews.title: Needed For Audio Interface
customer_reviews.text: I bought an audio interface so I could record some audio to a computer. The audio interface has a headphone jack, but I didn't realize that the jack would require a 6.35mm attachment. These worked great to allow me to use my normal (standard) 3.5mm headphones with the audio interface. Since they are priced the same as buying a single adapter, I now have two spares that I can keep handy in case anything happens.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Looks to be a solid quality. Packaging was simple enough. Nothing fancy. With these type of product you usually need a good 3-6 months before you see any deterioration or anything like that, so I will check back after a while to report if it is still solid or if there are any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fontana

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with the quality!
customer_reviews.text: I got this product because I needed a way to plug my headphones into my stereo receiver at night so I could listen to my records without bothering my family. The material is gold plated which I didn’t expect and am really grateful for because I use a headphone extender cable and the gold plating on this adapter helps in reducing loss in sound quality. The fact that I was able to get multiple was only a bonus to me. I think the price for 3 may have even been fair for just one.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeve

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality adapters.
customer_reviews.text: These adapters worked perfectly to hook up my headphones to my digital piano. I had thought that something was wrong with my piano because I was only hearing out of one side of my headphones. Turns out my adapter was the problem. Plugged this in and voila. Stereo! Order came right on time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Wade

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, and good value for money.
customer_reviews.text: These look like they are well built, and in fact they look beautiful. I suspect tolerances could be better on the internal part, the 3.5mm plug moves a little bit more than I would like, so I suspect it might wear out. But a great buy. (In the long term I hope to find a source of high quality 3.5mm plugs WITH accompanying threaded 1/4 adapters, but this is nowhere to be found)
customer_reviews.author: Thorium

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: They work well plugged into the headphone jack of home stereo. It allows me to connect a Bluetooth transmitter so that I can listen to my over the ear headphones without any cord in the way. Great while cleaning or just a lazy day zoning out on sofa. Sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality at Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: These adapters are exactly what you'd expect. The first one I tried was very tight, to the point I wondered if I'd purchased an incorrect size. But after sort of "forcing" the headphone jack in 1 time, it's worked perfectly. Highly recommended and quite nice looking!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Patton

customer_reviews.title: Don't work, guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: When plugging into my interface to route my PC sound to my monitor speakers, if I plug the 3.5mm jacks all the way into the adapter sound is crap. If is plug them I get most of my sound but missing right stereo. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Art By Clint

customer_reviews.title: Need one? Get 5 instead!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say?! When you need one, you need one.. these stick out a little more in my soundboard, but no biggie. Same price as buying one plastic one in the big box stores. These sound decent and am running pairs of nice headphones through them for podcasting.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Jax

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Hi, these work great. I like the short body, reduces potential jack damage. I have only had these a few days, so can't speak to durability. If they last well I will upgrade to 5, if they start breaking I will downgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First Impression
customer_reviews.text: These M-F adapters have only been used once (other components for the real application are on the way) and worked, though a little flakey. I cannot tell whether it is the female 6.35 mm socket or the adapter, but spinning the adapter in the socket seems to have cleared up the connection. If you ask in a month, I will have a more complete evaluation.
customer_reviews.author: Semaj

customer_reviews.title: Complete crap. Stay away!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping with a 3 pack at least one of them would work. Complete crap. Tried several different headphones and different stereo receivers. ALL 3 of the adapters had terrible static and cutting out of sound. And yes the headphones worked fine by themselves with other devices. I refuse to eat the cost even though it's a small inexpensive item. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Feels like very high quality material, strurdy. The one i replaced had black plastic holder that woble. This one is metal, 3.5 mm jack that plug to it doesn't move at all. Sound on the headphones that I use is the same, it has good connection. Very good product 👍
customer_reviews.author: sonny

customer_reviews.title: Solid connection!
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble connecting a Bluetooth dongle that required this adapter to my AVR with one that I already owned The electronic connection required wiggling to make a connection which often later failed. I figured it was easier and less expensive to replace the adapter as a first attempt at a fix than to have the female port in the receiver checked. Your adapter has solved the problem - with spares!
customer_reviews.author: Trilogy

customer_reviews.title: so good. I've bought quite a few 1/4" to 1/8" ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've bought quite a few 1/4" to 1/8" adapters over the past few years (why amps still have 1/4" jacks when you cannot buy headphones with 1/4" plugs for less than $500 is still beyond me. Up til now my kids have managed to destroy the previous adapters in less than a week. These are built like tanks (which is why I bought them) and I'm really hoping with three of them to have bought a few months of silence during multiple-hour-long Call of Duty sessions.
customer_reviews.author: D. Newlander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to use with a used Yamaha keyboard we had purchased for our son so he could use his headphones when practicing. They are good quality and work well, and allow him to use his earbuds from his iPad with the keyboard so we don’t hear him practicing. We purchased the 3 pack so if he loses one we still have a couple of extras. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: It's a zoo

customer_reviews.title: One DOA, Two Defective
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. One of these wouldn't fit any 3.5mm jack. The other two were ok on the 3.5mm side, but didn't fit the 1/4 jack on my headphone amp (and neither would the DOA one, which tells me this is just a design flaw). I have several other 1/4 to 3.5mm adaptors that work just fine with the headphone amp. I am baffled that this product has so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Works well but I shouldn't even have had to buy it.
customer_reviews.text: They work great but, <rant> Who the F buys fancy pants 6.35mm (AKA 1/4") headphones for they're consumer grade HT receiver? I'll tell you, NOBODY. So why do they put that size on the receiver? I'll tell you why, so you have to spend more money on a stupid adapter so you're normal headphones work with this. </rant>
customer_reviews.author: PrimeExample

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit, but otherwise good quality
customer_reviews.text: The adapters are good quality materials, but the 1/8” female socket is tight... too tight. The hole tolerance is correct, it’s more likely the spring loaded connectors on the inside that’s creating the tight fit. Might have to add some graphite. Requires force to remove my 1/8” headphone plug. Better than being too loose, but not as good a fit as others adapters I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jdpenk

customer_reviews.title: Good adapters
customer_reviews.text: These are well-made and don't take a lot of room. I wanted these for my HAM radio equipment that has 1/4" phone jacks. These plugs do not stick out very far and I can just leave them plugged into the radio when using 3.5mm accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Waynemia

customer_reviews.title: These are nice!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for mixing 3.5mm audio from different sources into headphones. They work great for stereo signals. I do not notice any noise caused by these. They look good and appear to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: One and done - Fall apart with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: These things fall apart when you pull your headphones (or rca cable adapter) out of the plug back. Two of the three adapters have broken on their first use; each into three pieces: insertion ring for your headphone jack, a piece just under that ring that is threaded and the main body of the plug. Poorly made. Used with Sony MDR7506 Professional Headphones / Mackie Pro FX12V2 and standard rca cable adapter (as an input).
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Solid affordable adapters.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about these adapters stood out as extraordinary but I was surprised by the solid build. I use these in a music production environment so I can’t tolerate any drop outs or crackle and hum from my headphones. So far, these adapters sound clean and all three worked. I’ve had them for a few weeks now and have had no issues. I’d recommend them as solid budget adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: At first, they work great, until the metal sleeve comes loose on the 3.5mm side. When it starts free spinning, you know the jack is on it's last leg, and soon sound will start cutting out when you wiggle the cable. I am having a hard time finding ones that last, but this is not one of them. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Smith

customer_reviews.title: DOES WHAT IT IS SUPPOSED TO DO
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product delivered on time. I have had other purchases of similar products where either the male end did not make the proper connections OR, the female end was too tight/loose for the 1/8" male connections. No problems evident at all here.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo L. Larrabure

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.  Great service.
customer_reviews.text: Imagine requiring a "headphone jack" for recording purposes. Somehow, the one attached to your sound board has grown legs and ran away all on it's own. So, other than ripping off my own headphones at home, I turn to you. You respond with top quality product that basically saves the day for my 2-day live video project this coming weekend. I'll never forget you for the hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Hedd Roxx

customer_reviews.title: They are good quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a musician and can always use and keep these type of plugs on hand. These are mono plugs, he actually wanted “stereo” plugs, that have the extra black tip on the end.
customer_reviews.author: A new fan of Suzi's

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter for your instrument and/or headphones
customer_reviews.text: These adapters work great! They're of high quality, and don't have a lot of 'give' with the instrument/headphones you plug into them. Meaning, these devices plug in really tight, so that the device doesn't come out super easy.v
customer_reviews.author: Vinny The Review Guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fitting, durable adapters - digital piano use
customer_reviews.text: The adapter(s) fit properly into my digital piano and my headphone jack fit snugly into the adapter. These adapters are hefty and look and feel well built. I have not noticed any static or bad sound coming through the headphones. The sound is crystal clear and without distortion or other affect. I can without any hesitation recommend these adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Pkripper

customer_reviews.title: These cables fit perfectly to my head phones
customer_reviews.text: These cables fit perfectly fine for my head phones to my cd tape recorder!! Thank you!!👋 I'm back in business very clear sound. No problems so far. I'm sure these will come in useful for other connections as well. What a lifesaving device! Thank you! Received within 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: MarieTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These arrived a day late, but that was fine. They look shiny and are very well put together. They fit perfectly and there is absolutely no problem with the sound quality. The connection is pretty strong. I'm happy with getting 3 because now I have 2 extra ones if I misplace one.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I Recommend these Adapters for Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Received these a few days ago and so far EXELLENT, nice snug fit, sturdy and seems well made no static or distortion as my last adapters had with loose fit and In Happy to play with my headphones without stopping to twist and adjust because of improper fitting.. PS Some people gave bad reviews, But as with anything we buy we should handle with care if we value our things, I always do Even with items with good warranties.. Just a Habit
customer_reviews.author: Vonn Lee

customer_reviews.title: Jack adapter sent from the heavens
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes a simple product surprises you with its grace and design. I thought I was ordering a headphone jack adapter, instead, I found happiness. Every time I plug them in, I wonder what the engineers are doing now, how they are making life better in other subtle ways. The only way these could be improved is if they tasted slightly better. The metallic aftertaste lingers unless you eat something shortly after. Do not swallow.
customer_reviews.author: John Bowie

customer_reviews.title: Wish Quality is More Consistent
customer_reviews.text: I saw mixed review on whether this thing can work with earbuds for smartphone (for the curious people, TRRS plug, the headphone plug with three rings on it) and decided to take a gamble. The result: one in three works perfectly, the other two gives worse result than the one I borrowed from local headphone store. I wish they bin the part and charge more for adapters that worked with it, I am more than happy to pay extra to solve my problem, not be a technical expert on headphone standard. For reference, I am using Schiit Fulla with V-Moda Zinc (iPhone version) and HD 6XX. Will update the review if the only working one broke on me.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are great! First of all, they looked so good, I had to have them. And when I got the package, I was pleasantly surprised to see how much care they took to make sure that the finish on each one of these remained intact. Not only were all 3 in a bag, but each 1 was individually placed in its own small bag. And finally, as soon as I plugged one of them in, I could immediately tell that it was a quality adapter. Just, perfect feel when I plugged in to my guitar amp. And when I plugged my bluetooth receiver into it. And yeah, it does look great!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan T.

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: They attach easily to 3.5mm jacks and sound good in my ancient stereo system (that also sounds good, which is why I still have it). Good price, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jasan Fujii

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE! ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: to keep things simple, i bought these to use with my dj controller. I went through ALL 3 IN A WEEK!!!! EVERY SINGLE ONE of them fell just fell apart while using it. after plugging it in only once or twice. just fell apart! the last one fell apart in my hand before i ever plugged it in!!! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: Nice finish, good quality
customer_reviews.text: These securely hold in the 3.5mm side and the feel of the finish on the adapter is quite good, this glossy-bronze/gold. There's enough space for your thumbs on the part where you'd grip it to put it in/out of the larger jacks without much issue.
customer_reviews.author: RyansChilling

customer_reviews.title: VSX-1020 works great paired with a bluetooth transmitter
customer_reviews.text: Since I didn't want to spend $100 on a bluetooth adapter on ebay, I got one on amazon which only had the regular headphone male end, this allowed me to pipe sound to bluetooth speakers. No more cables, no mess, no static. Works well, will update if something changes. Someday when I own a home I'll update to in the wall wiring, in the meantime, this works perfectly well for the roku/bt speaker setup. Not for audiophiles, for sure, but works well for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Kempter

customer_reviews.title: So simple, I can’t believe any modern factory could screw it up.
customer_reviews.text: 2 broke the first time I used them. 1 broke before being used, from rolling around in my guitar case. Such a simple product, it takes a truly faulty manufacturing process and materials to screw up this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: 2 BROKE WITHIN 10 DAYS OF OWNING.
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 of these and they were both broken within 10 days of use. The other hasn't broken yet, but hasn't been used either because the tip broke off in my piano and I can't use it until I am able to retrieve the tip of the adapter from within my piano. Bad quality--wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TheMrs.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for 3!
customer_reviews.text: Needed an adapter for headphones to system. Only needed 1 but for the price, getting 3 was great! (Bound to "misplace" another one eventually!
customer_reviews.author: The Traveling Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and ok quality *updated review*
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had them long, but a pack of 3 for little money... :) **updated review** I've tossed two out from the lot. Other night whilst recording, I had to troubleshoot noisy headphones on the vocalists end: came to find this adapter was causing the hum...
customer_reviews.author: celticpiping

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: This adapter is excellent. I had just bought TWO 1/4” to 3.5mm adapter from Guitar Center for $10 apiece, and they both broke in a single day. This adapter is heavier which tells me it’s made with denser/stronger materials. It looked much nicer. It was way more affordable. It worked perfectly. And who knows how long it’ll last, but I can tell you that it won’t break the same day you buy like that Guitar Center trash. I’m very pleased. Definitely don’t go to Guitar center.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Paz

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've bought these adapters. They work great and do what they do. i've never had a problem. Thanks guys and keep up the good work!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Montagnino

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart... cheap stuff
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three were in pieces when I opened the bag. At least one of them works. The ends were not staked so they just fell apart. Not worth the $6.99 to drive to Kohls to return it. I will buy a better quality next time.
customer_reviews.author: MikeH

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet. They are intended to be used at our church for different audio programs that require the use of a device that has a 3.5 audio connection. We look forward to using them
customer_reviews.author: William A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice adaptors, better than most
customer_reviews.text: Nice little adaptors so you can use a 3.5mm headphone plug with a conventional 1/4" headphone jack. Solid build, no shorts. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: W. Cate

customer_reviews.title: School use
customer_reviews.text: I teach Kindergarten and in order to stop the spread of lice each child needs to use their own headphones for the listening to reading center. Luckily these female jacks plug into my splitter and multiple students are able to listen in at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately one of these adapters failed. Although it accepted the 1/8" phone plug firmly the first few times, the jack will no longer hold the plug. Is falls out. This is the same problem I had with another similar adapter. These seem to be good for a few uses, and after that they break.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Richards

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy. These are terrible
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to use with my audio interface to listen to my input. the sound quality on all three is terrible. very muffled and distorted. stay very far away.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Williams

customer_reviews.title: bad connection
customer_reviews.text: looks sturdy but L/R cuts in and out when you jiggle it
customer_reviews.author: tcookc

customer_reviews.title: Poor inner barrell 3.5mm connection. Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Poor connection in all 3 3.5mm female ends after checking with 5+ different 3.5mm audio cables that ranged from IXCC, Amazon, X2 Stock Cable, GreenTech, and a few others. Ended up throwing them out. Don't waste your money trying to save a few dollars. You can spend the same price on 1 single adapter that actually works elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, works, quick.
customer_reviews.text: Adapting the 1/4" amp and mixer jacks with new headphones and personal audio gear for home practice spaces. Always need just one more plug. Three is a good number in a pack.
customer_reviews.author: A. Squitieri

customer_reviews.title: They work just fine
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered two sets of these over the course of a year or two. They work great. Sometimes one in a set has a questionable finish, but they still work.
customer_reviews.author: Trash Boat

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 ain't bad
customer_reviews.text: I received 3... for a great price... one of them has a defect because it does not work at all. The other two work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These adapters are great. They are very well made and look durable. They were received very quickly. Do not forget, these are becoming hard to find in stores, so it pays to stock up on them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: Very High Quality Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy to see the quality construction of these adapters. They are well designed and the operation of these is excellent. They appear to be strong and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Digichip

customer_reviews.title: Massive sound quality deterioration
customer_reviews.text: All three had decreased volume and sound clarity compared to my Sennheiser plug. Not sure if I just had a bad batch, but the ones I got were terrible.
customer_reviews.author: William Prince

customer_reviews.title: 3.5mm to 1/4 adapter
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No noise or anything like that. They appear to be well made from good materials. I'd buy more from this seller when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Todd T.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fitness instructor at the gym. The adapter that's provided doesn't give a good connection, it seems to be getting progressively worse. I bought this pack to use instead, and so far so good! They seem to be well made and much better quality than what I've been using. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: sierralaken

customer_reviews.title: Completely honest and a very detailed review.
customer_reviews.text: Complete and outer garbage, most of the highly rated reviews here are company reviews by the people that made the product. Not one of the three works they all fell apart and are totally useless.Kidding about the detailed review, i figure if companies are allowed to submit reviews and lie about the product they sell, why cant i lie about a detailed review?
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Conville

product_meta.title: Aurum Cables 3-Pack 6.35mm Male to 3.5mm Female Stereo Adapter
product_meta.description:
Size:3 Pack

Designed to connect a 3.5mm Cable and covert it to a 6.35mm plug. Used with Mixers and music applications. It can connect earphones and headphones, electric pianos, guitars, and other instruments, mixers, and specialist audio, speakers, microphones or Phones, MP3 players into amplifiers. 

 

Specifications



 -Input 3 Conductor Stereo 3.5mm (1/8 inch) Jack

 -Output 3 Conductor Stereo 6.5mm (1/4 inch) Plug
feature_bullets: Convenient and cost-effective 3-pack 6.35 (1/4 inch) Plug (Male) to 3.5mm (1/8 inch) Jack (Female) Stereo Adapter
Perfect for a 6.35 stereo port to accept a standard stereo cable with 3.5mm plug
Connect Headphones or Microphones with 1/8 inch plugs to Audio devices with a 1/4 inch Stereo jack
Makes your favorite headphones or other devices compatible with most pro audio and home audio equipment!
360 degree grip treads help easy plugging and unplugging

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,732 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
